bknd-0001.title: CSV_to_BIM

args.name: Min
args.help: Min id of building to run in workflow.

args.name: Max
args.help: Max id of building to run in workflow.

args.name: Building source file
args.help: Path to buildings database file.

cmd.usage:
usage: CSV_to_BIM.py [-h] [--buildingFile BUILDINGFILE]
                     [--buildingSourceFile BUILDINGSOURCEFILE] [--Min MIN]
                     [--Max MAX] [--getRV [GETRV]]

optional arguments:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  --buildingFile BUILDINGFILE
  --buildingSourceFile BUILDINGSOURCEFILE
  --Min MIN
  --Max MAX
  --getRV [GETRV]

bknd-0001.summary: Parses building source information from CSV and saves into BIM.json files for each building.

args.name: Min
args.help: min id of building to obtain BIM for

args.name: Max
args.help: max id of building to obtain BIM for

args.name: buildingSourceFile
args.help: path to buildings file

args.name: config
args.help: path to buildings config file

args.name: buildingFile
args.help: name of JSON file containing an array of id,filename pairs. For each building id the application creates a BIM file with name filename

args.name: Min
args.help: min id of building to obtain BIM for

args.name: Max
args.help: max id of building to obtain BIM for

args.name: buildingSourceFile
args.help: path to buildings database file

args.name: configFile
args.help: path to workflow config file

cmd.usage:
usage: GeoJSON_to_BIM.py [-h] [--buildingFile BUILDINGFILE]
                         [--buildingSourceFile BUILDINGSOURCEFILE] [--Min MIN]
                         [--Max MAX] [--getRV [GETRV]]

optional arguments:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  --buildingFile BUILDINGFILE
  --buildingSourceFile BUILDINGSOURCEFILE
  --Min MIN
  --Max MAX
  --getRV [GETRV]

bknd-0012.title: StochasticWindWittigSinha

args.name: BIM file
args.help: File containing a dictionary of building information.

cmd.usage:
usage:
  StochasticWind  options

where options are:
  -?, -h, --help                           display usage information
  --filenameEVENT &ltEvent file location>    Location where generated time
                                           history should be stored
  --filenameBIM &ltBIM file location>        Location where building
                                           information model is stored
  --seed &ltSeed value>                      Seed value that should be used to
                                           generate time histories
  -r, --getRV                              Flag indicating whether the
                                           generated event file should
                                           specify random variable

bknd-0012.summary: Application file creating EVENT.json files for stochastic wind fields based on the Witting-Sinha method. Supports Wind hazard events.

bknd-0013.title: StochasticGroundMotion

args.name: BIM file
args.help: File containing a dictionary of building information.

cmd.usage:
usage:
  StochasticGM  options

where options are:
  -?, -h, --help                           display usage information
  --modelName &ltModel name>                 Name of stochastic model to use
  --filenameEVENT &ltEvent file location>    Location where generated time
                                           history should be stored
  --filenameBIM &ltBIM file location>        Location where building
                                           information model is stored
  --seed &ltSeed value>                      Seed value that should be used to
                                           generate time histories
  -r, --getRV                              Flag indicating whether the
                                           generated event file should
                                           specify random variable

bknd-0013.summary: Application file for creating EVENT.json files for stochastic ground motion events based on the ___ GMPE. Supports Earthquake hazard events.

bknd-0019.title: MDOF-LU

args.name: BIM file
args.help: File containing a dictionary of building information.

args.name: EVENT file
args.help: File containing event intensity measure for each simulation per building.

args.name: HAZUS data
args.help: Defines location of the HAZUS building configuration file.

args.name: stdStiffness
args.help: Defines the standard deviation that should be considered when sampling the stiffness for the building.

args.name: stdDamping
args.help: Defines the standard deviation that should be considered when sampling the damping ratio for the building.

bknd-0019.summary: Creates SAM.json file and generates script for creating a hysteretic multi-degree of freedom (MDOF) system subject to earthquake time history analysis, based on the Lu method. Analysis is executed by the OpenSeesSimulation application.

bknd-0020.title: OpenSeesInput

args.name: filenameBIM
args.help: name of bim file

args.name: filenameEVENT
args.help: name of file containing the event data

args.name: filenameSAM
args.help: name of file containing the outputted SAM

bknd-0020.summary: Creates SAM.json file containing model information for an input OpenSees structural model. Analysis is executed in the OpenSeesSimulation application.

bknd-0021.title: OpenSeesPyInput

args.name: filenameBIM
args.help: File containing a dictionary of building information.

args.name: filenameEVENT
args.help: File containing event intensity measure for each simulation per building.

args.name: modelPath
args.help: Defines the location of the input OpenSeesPy model files.

args.name: mainScript
args.help: Defines the name of the main model file which contains the build_model and run_analysis functions.

args.name: ndm
args.help: Defines the number of degrees of freedom in the numerical model.

args.name: dofMap
args.help: By default, the workflow assumes X=1, Y=2, Z=3 mapping between directions and degrees of freedom, with XY being the horizontal directions. This input allows you to define an alternative mapping by providing three numbers separated by commas in a string, such as '1, 3, 2' if you wish to have Y as the vertical direction.

args.name: ctrlNodes
args.help: Defines the IDs of nodes in the OpenSeesPy model where EDPs are recorded. If the number of ctrlNodes provided exceeds the number of stories, only the firsts n+1 nodes will be used for an n-story building.

args.name: filenameSAM
args.help: File containing model information for response simulation.

cmd.usage:
usage: OpenSeesPyInput.py [-h] [--filenameBIM FILENAMEBIM]
                          [--filenameEVENT FILENAMEEVENT]
                          [--filenameSAM FILENAMESAM]
                          [--mainScript MAINSCRIPT] [--modelPath MODELPATH]
                          [--ndm NDM] [--dofMap DOFMAP] [--getRV [GETRV]]

optional arguments:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  --filenameBIM FILENAMEBIM
  --filenameEVENT FILENAMEEVENT
  --filenameSAM FILENAMESAM
  --mainScript MAINSCRIPT
  --modelPath MODELPATH
  --ndm NDM
  --dofMap DOFMAP
  --getRV [GETRV]

bknd-0021.summary: Creates SAM.json file containing model information for an input OpenSeesPy structural model. The functions 'build_model' and 'run_analysis' must be defined in the model script. Analysis is executed in the OpenSeesPySimulation application.

args.name: filenameBIM
args.help: name of bim file

args.name: filenameEVENT
args.help: name of file containing the event data

args.name: filenameSAM
args.help: name of file containing the outputted SAM

args.name: filenameBIM
args.help: name of bim file

args.name: filenameEVENT
args.help: name of file containing the event data

args.name: filenameSAM
args.help: name of file containing the outputted SAM

cmd.usage:
usage: main_program.py [-h] [--filenameBIM FILENAMEBIM]
                       [--filenameEVENT FILENAMEEVENT]
                       [--filenameSAM FILENAMESAM] [--fileName FILENAME]
                       [--filePath FILEPATH] [--getRV [GETRV]]

optional arguments:

  --filenameBIM FILENAMEBIM
  --filenameEVENT FILENAMEEVENT
  --filenameSAM FILENAMESAM
  --fileName FILENAME
  --filePath FILEPATH
  --getRV [GETRV]

bknd-0036.title: Dakota-FEM

args.name: filenameBIM
args.help: File containing a dictionary of building information.

args.name: filenameEVENT
args.help: File containing event intensity measure for each simulation per building.

args.name: filenameSAM
args.help: File containing model information for response simulation.

args.name: filenameEDP
args.help: File containing type, location, and direction of recorded EDPs from the response simulation.

args.name: filenameSIM
args.help: File containing constants, settings, and methods for the response simulation. This file is deleted after the application is executed.

args.name: driverFile
args.help: Batch file containing commands for Dakota to execute, located in the working directory for each simulation.

args.name: method
args.help: Defines the UQ sampling method to use.

args.name: samples
args.help: Specifies the number of realizations to generate. For surrogate models, these samples are used to train the model.

args.name: seed
args.help: Specifies the random seed for sampling.

args.name: samples2
args.help: Only for surrogate models. Specifies the number of realizations to generate from the trained model.

args.name: seed2
args.help: Only for surrogate models. Specifies the random seed to generate samples from the models.

args.name: ismethod
args.help: Specifies the importance sampling method to use

args.name: concurrency
args.help: Specifies the number of processes to use for simulation.

args.name: keepSamples
args.help: True if the intermediate results shall be kept (not deleted) for each sample.

bknd-0036.summary: Uses the uncertainty quantification package Dakota to sample random variables and execute the workflow driver file.

bknd-0037.title: Dakota-UQ

args.name: filenameBIM
args.help: File containing a dictionary of building information.

args.name: filenameEVENT
args.help: File containing event intensity measure for each simulation per building.

args.name: filenameSAM
args.help: File containing model information for response simulation.

args.name: filenameEDP
args.help: File containing type, location, and direction of recorded EDPs from the response simulation.

args.name: filenameSIM
args.help: File containing constants, settings, and methods for the response simulation. This file is deleted after the application is executed.

args.name: driverFile
args.help: Batch file containing commands for Dakota to execute, located in the working directory for each simulation.

args.name: method
args.help: Defines the UQ sampling method to use.

args.name: samples
args.help: Specifies the number of realizations to generate. For surrogate models, these samples are used to train the model.

args.name: seed
args.help: Specifies the random seed for sampling.

args.name: samples2
args.help: Only for surrogate models. Specifies the number of realizations to generate from the trained model.

args.name: seed2
args.help: Only for surrogate models. Specifies the random seed to generate samples from the models.

args.name: ismethod
args.help: Specifies the importance sampling method to use

args.name: concurrency
args.help: Specifies the number of processes to use for simulation.

args.name: keepSamples
args.help: True if the intermediate results shall be kept (not deleted) for each sample.

cmd.usage:
usage: DakotaFEM.py [-h] [--filenameBIM FILENAMEBIM]
                    [--filenameSAM FILENAMESAM]
                    [--filenameEVENT FILENAMEEVENT]
                    [--filenameEDP FILENAMEEDP] [--filenameSIM FILENAMESIM]
                    [--driverFile DRIVERFILE] [--method METHOD]
                    [--samples SAMPLES] [--seed SEED] [--samples2 SAMPLES2]
                    [--seed2 SEED2] [--ismethod ISMETHOD]
                    [--dataMethod DATAMETHOD] [--dataMethod2 DATAMETHOD2]
                    [--type TYPE] [--concurrency CONCURRENCY]
                    [--keepSamples KEEPSAMPLES] [--runType RUNTYPE]

optional arguments:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  --filenameBIM FILENAMEBIM
  --filenameSAM FILENAMESAM
  --filenameEVENT FILENAMEEVENT
  --filenameEDP FILENAMEEDP
  --filenameSIM FILENAMESIM
  --driverFile DRIVERFILE
  --method METHOD
  --samples SAMPLES
  --seed SEED
  --samples2 SAMPLES2
  --seed2 SEED2
  --ismethod ISMETHOD
  --dataMethod DATAMETHOD
  --dataMethod2 DATAMETHOD2
  --type TYPE
  --concurrency CONCURRENCY
  --keepSamples KEEPSAMPLES
  --runType RUNTYPE

bknd-0037.summary: Uses the uncertainty quantification package Dakota to sample random variables and execute the workflow driver file.

args.help: File containing constants, settings, and methods for the response simulation. This file is deleted after the application is executed.

args.name: driverFile
args.help: Batch file containing commands for Dakota to execute, located in the working directory for each simulation.

args.name: method

args.name: samples
args.help: Specifies the number of realizations to generate. For surrogate models, these samples are used to train the model.

args.name: seed
args.help: Specifies the random seed for sampling.

args.name: samples2
args.help: Only for surrogate models. Specifies the number of realizations to generate from the trained model.

args.name: seed2
args.help: Only for surrogate models. Specifies the random seed to generate samples from the models.

args.name: ismethod

args.name: concurrency

cmd.usage:
usage: DakotaFEM1.py [-h] [--filenameBIM FILENAMEBIM]
                     [--filenameSAM FILENAMESAM]

                     [--filenameEDP FILENAMEEDP] [--filenameSIM FILENAMESIM]
                     [--driverFile DRIVERFILE] [--method METHOD]
                     [--samples SAMPLES] [--seed SEED] [--ismethod ISMETHOD]
                     [--dataMethod DATAMETHOD]
                     [--trainingSamples TRAININGSAMPLES]
                     [--trainingSeed TRAININGSEED]
                     [--trainingMethod TRAININGMETHOD]
                     [--samplingSamples SAMPLINGSAMPLES]
                     [--samplingSeed SAMPLINGSEED]
                     [--samplingMethod SAMPLINGMETHOD] [--type TYPE]
                     [--concurrency CONCURRENCY] [--keepSamples KEEPSAMPLES]
                     [--runType RUNTYPE]

bknd-0044.title: pelicun

args.name: DL file
args.help: File containing the DL model information. The default is to source it from the building source file.

args.name: EDP file
args.help: File containing type, location, and direction of recorded EDPs from the response simulation.

args.name: DL_Method
args.help: Defines the damage and loss assessment method. Available choices include 'FEMA P58', 'HAZUS MH EQ', 'HAZUS MH', 'HAZUS MH EQ IM', and 'HAZUS MH HU'.

args.name: Realizations
args.help: Specifies the number of loss realizations to generate.

args.name: detailed_results
args.help: If False, only the main results are saved to improve efficiency.

args.name: log_file
args.help: If False, pelicun does not create a run log file.

args.name: coupled_EDP
args.help: If True, the raw EDPs are used as-is without resampling.

args.name: event_time
args.help: Defines the time of the event in YYYY-MM-DD:HH format. 'off' turns all time-effects off.

args.name: ground_failure
args.help: If True, fragility groups associated with ground failure are added in the auto-population phase. Note that such analysis requires PGD values as inputs.

cmd.usage:
2021-01-12T21:07:32Z First line of DL_calculation
usage: DL_calculation.py [-h] [--filenameDL FILENAMEDL]
                         [--filenameEDP FILENAMEEDP] [--DL_Method DL_METHOD]
                         [--Realizations REALIZATIONS] [--outputEDP OUTPUTEDP]
                         [--outputDM OUTPUTDM] [--outputDV OUTPUTDV]
                         [--dirnameOutput DIRNAMEOUTPUT]
                         [--event_time EVENT_TIME]
                         [--detailed_results [DETAILED_RESULTS]]
                         [--coupled_EDP [COUPLED_EDP]] [--log_file [LOG_FILE]]
                         [--ground_failure [GROUND_FAILURE]]
                         [--auto_script AUTO_SCRIPT]

optional arguments:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  --filenameDL FILENAMEDL
  --filenameEDP FILENAMEEDP
  --DL_Method DL_METHOD
  --Realizations REALIZATIONS
  --outputEDP OUTPUTEDP
  --outputDM OUTPUTDM
  --outputDV OUTPUTDV
  --dirnameOutput DIRNAMEOUTPUT
  --event_time EVENT_TIME
  --detailed_results [DETAILED_RESULTS]
  --coupled_EDP [COUPLED_EDP]
  --log_file [LOG_FILE]
  --ground_failure [GROUND_FAILURE]
  --auto_script AUTO_SCRIPT

bknd-0044.summary: Performs damage and loss (DL) assessment using the pelicun Python package. The application uses built-in fragility functions and the replacement cost defined in the building source file to determine damage state and loss likelihoods.

bknd-0045.title: NearestNeighborEvents

args.name: eventGrid
args.help: path to file containing location information on each event file

args.name: samples
args.help: number of event samples to assign to each building

args.name: neighbors
args.help: number of neighboring event sites to sample from

cmd.usage:
usage: NNE.py [-h] [--buildingFile BUILDINGFILE]
              [--filenameEVENTgrid FILENAMEEVENTGRID] [--samples SAMPLES]
              [--neighbors NEIGHBORS] [--filter_label FILTER_LABEL]

optional arguments:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  --buildingFile BUILDINGFILE
  --filenameEVENTgrid FILENAMEEVENTGRID
  --samples SAMPLES
  --neighbors NEIGHBORS
  --filter_label FILTER_LABEL

bknd-0045.summary: Assigns events to building site by sampling from nearest neighboring event sites, using coordinate locations. The user specifies the number of sampled events and the number of neighbors to sample events from.
